Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • Level
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Level0, Level1, Level2

    public abstract class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    A base class for all levels.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Level() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract Automaton applyConstraints(Automaton aut)
      Returns an automaton equal to the given automaton with the constraints of this level applied to it.
      protected Automaton constraintFindAtLeastTwoTreasures()
      Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which at least two treasures are found.
      protected Automaton constraintFindAtLeastTwoTreasuresAndLoseAllWhenPassingThroughArc()
      Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which at least two treasures are found and, while all treasures are lost when passing through an arc.
      protected Automaton constraintFindKeyBeforePassingThroughGates()
      Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which a key is found before passing through any gates.
      protected Automaton constraintFindNoTreasuresAfterDragonHasBeenPassed()
      Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which no treasures are found once a dragon has been passed.
      protected Automaton constraintJumpInRiverWhenPassingDragonWithoutSword()
      Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which a river is passed immediately after every dragon when a sword in not found first.
      protected void run(java.lang.String[] args)
      Runs this level with the given arguments.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • applyConstraints

        protected abstract Automaton applyConstraints(Automaton aut)
        Returns an automaton equal to the given automaton with the constraints of this level applied to it.
        Parameters:
        aut - the automaton to apply the constraints to
        Returns:
        an automaton equal to the given automaton with the constraints of this level applied to it

      • constraintFindAtLeastTwoTreasures

        protected final Automaton constraintFindAtLeastTwoTreasures()
        Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which at least two treasures are found.
        Returns:
        an automaton representing the constraint

      • constraintFindAtLeastTwoTreasuresAndLoseAllWhenPassingThroughArc

        protected final Automaton constraintFindAtLeastTwoTreasuresAndLoseAllWhenPassingThroughArc()
        Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which at least two treasures are found and, while all treasures are lost when passing through an arc.
        Returns:
        an automaton representing the constraint

      • constraintFindKeyBeforePassingThroughGates

        protected final Automaton constraintFindKeyBeforePassingThroughGates()
        Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which a key is found before passing through any gates.
        Returns:
        an automaton representing the constraint

      • constraintFindNoTreasuresAfterDragonHasBeenPassed

        protected final Automaton constraintFindNoTreasuresAfterDragonHasBeenPassed()
        Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which no treasures are found once a dragon has been passed.
        Returns:
        an automaton representing the constraint

      • constraintJumpInRiverWhenPassingDragonWithoutSword

        protected final Automaton constraintJumpInRiverWhenPassingDragonWithoutSword()
        Returns an automaton accepting only the paths on which a river is passed immediately after every dragon when a sword in not found first.
        Returns:
        an automaton representing the constraint

      • run

        protected final void run(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs this level with the given arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments, of which the first one must be the filename of the '.aut' file representing the automaton to check, any other arguments are ignored
